description: The IN3 segment contains additional insurance information for certifying the need for patient care. Fields used by this segment are defined by HCFA, or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Set ID - IN3
fields.description: IN3-1-set ID-IN3 contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment the sequence number shall be 1, for the second occurrence it shall be 2, etc. The set ID in the IN3 segment is used when there are multiple certifications for the insurance plan identified in IN1-2.

fields.name: Certification Number
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit
fields.description: This field contains the number assigned by the certification agency. The assigning authority and identifier type code are strongly recommended for all CX data types.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: Defined as in the CK data type (see Section 2.8.5, CK - composite ID with check digit) except that a ST data type is allowed instead of a NM data type.

fields.name: Check Digit
fields.description: Defined as in the CK data type (see Section 2.8.5, CK - composite ID with check digit) except that an ST data type is allowed instead of an NM data type. The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Defined as in the CK data type (see Section 2.8.5, CK - composite ID with check digit). Refer to HL7 table 0061- Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique name of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: Subcomponents: <namespace ID (IS)> & < universal ID (ST)> & <universal ID type (ID)>

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Certified By
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the party that approved the certification. Multiple names and identifiers for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Certification Required
fields.description: This field indicates whether certification is required. Refer to HL7table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Penalty
fields.description: This field contains the penalty, in dollars or a percentage, that will be assessed if the pre-certification is not performed. Refer to user-defined table 0148 - Penalty type for suggested values.

fields.name: Certification Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date and time stamp that indicates when insurance was certified to exist for the patient.

fields.name: Certification Modify Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the certification was modified.

fields.name: Operator
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the name party who is responsible for sending this certification information. Multiple names for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Certification Begin Date
fields.description: This field contains the date that this certification begins.

fields.name: Certification End Date
fields.description: This field contains date that this certification ends.

fields.name: Days
fields.description: This field contains the number of days for which this certification is valid. This field applies to denied, pending, or approved days. Refer to user-defined table 0149 - Day type for suggested values.

fields.name: Non-Concur Code/Description
fields.description: This field contains the non-concur code and description for a denied request. User-defined table 0233 - Non-concur code/description is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Non-Concur Effective Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the effective date of the non-concurrence classification.

fields.name: Physician Reviewer
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the physician who works with and reviews cases that are pending physician review for the certification agency. Multiple names for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2. User-defined table 0010 - Physician ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of value for this field .

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Certification Contact
fields.description: This field contains the name of the party contacted at the certification agency who granted the certification and communicated the certification number.

fields.name: Certification Contact Phone Number
fields.description: This field contains the phone number of the certification contact. Multiple phone numbers for the same certification contact may be sent in this sequence. The primary phone number is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the primary telephone number is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.description: Defined as the TN data type (see Section 2.8.42, TN - telephone number), except that the length of the country access code has been increased to three.

fields.name: Telecommunication use Code
fields.description: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication equipment Type
fields.description: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Appeal Reason
fields.description: This field contains the reason that an appeal was made on a non-concur for certification. Refer to user-defined table 0345 - Appeal reason for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Certification Agency
fields.description: This field contains the certification agency. Refer to user-defined table 0346 - Certification agency for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Certification Agency Phone Number
fields.description: This field contains the phone number of the certification agency. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.description: Defined as the TN data type (see Section 2.8.42, TN - telephone number), except that the length of the country access code has been increased to three.

fields.name: Telecommunication use Code
fields.description: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication equipment Type
fields.description: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Pre-Certification Req/Window
fields.description: This field indicates whether pre-certification is required for particular patient types, and the time window for obtaining the certification. The following components of this field are defined as follows:

fields.name: Case Manager
fields.description: This field contains the name of the entity who/which is handling this particular patient's case (e.g., UR nurse, or a specific facility location).

fields.name: Second Opinion Date
fields.description: This field contains the date that the second opinion was obtained.

fields.name: Second Opinion Status
fields.description: This field contains the code that represents the status of the second opinion. User-defined table 0151 - Second opinion status is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table for this field. .

fields.name: Second Opinion Documentation Received
fields.description: Use this field if accompanying documentation has been received by the provider. User-defined table 0152 - Second opinion documentation received is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Second Opinion Physician
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains an identifier and name of the physician who provided the second opinion. Multiple names and identifiers for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2. User-defined table 0010 - Physician ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field .

fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.
